intro: Linnaea americana, commonly known as the American twinflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes other shrubs and flowering plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant features small, fragrant, white flowers that bloom in pairs, giving it its common name. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly wavy margin. Linnaea americana thrives in shaded, moist environments such as woodlands and thickets.
